Legal_Issue: Was the immigration officer's decision to deny the applicant's skilled worker application reasonable and procedurally fair?
Outcome: Decision quashed, case remanded for new determination by another officer
Legal_Provision: Assessment of all listed occupational categories, procedural fairness
Basis_of_Claim: Alleged lack of sufficient evidence of full-time experience
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to assess all five occupations, reliance on one category (Economist)
Application_Error: Officer focused only on one occupation and failed to assess the other four
Evidence_Ignored: Information related to four of the five listed occupational categories
Decision_Outcome: Denial of skilled worker visa application
Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness and procedural fairness of the decision
Outcome_of_Review: Decision quashed, case referred to another officer for reassessment
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of sufficient evidence of full-time experience as claimed
Evidentiary_Issues: Vague and insufficient notice requesting updated information
Procedural_Fairness: Violation due to inadequate communication and incomplete assessment
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging reasonableness and fairness
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide fair procedures in assessment
Omission_Type: Failure to assess all applicable occupational categories
